title: Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 452 of 2020)), hereby order as follows:
heading: 1. This Order may be cited as the Immigration Act 2004 (Visas)
text_raw:
1. This Order may be cited as the Immigration Act 2004 (Visas) 

(Amendment) (No. 3) Order 2022.

title: Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 452 of 2020)), hereby order as follows:
heading: 2. This Order comes into operation on 26 October 2022.
text_raw: 2. This Order comes into operation on 26 October 2022.

title: Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 452 of 2020)), hereby order as follows:
heading: 3. The Immigration Act 2004 (Visas) Order 2014 (S.I. No. 473 of 2014) is
text_raw:
3. The Immigration Act 2004 (Visas) Order 2014 (S.I. No. 473 of 2014) is 
amended in Schedule 3, by the deletion of “Belarus” and “Russian Federation”. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

25 October 2022. 

HELEN MCENTEE, 
Minister for Justice. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 28th October 2022. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [533] 3

title: Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 452 of 2020)), hereby order as follows:
heading: (This is not part of the Statutory Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This is not part of the Statutory Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

This Order amends the Immigration Act 2004 (Visas) Order 2014. The effect 
of this Order is to remove Belarus and Russian Federation from the list of 
countries included in the Short Stay Visa Waiver Programme (SSVWP). 

 
 
 
 
 
 4 [533]
